required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Supreme LMA and Proseal LMA in Prone Anesthetized Patient
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Effectiveness Between the LMA SupremeTM and the LMA ProsealTM for Airway Management in Patient Undergoing Elective Orthopaedic Surgery in Prone Position

brief_summary.textblock: There is no significant difference about success rate of two devices.

detailed_description.textblock: There is no significant difference about success rate of two device: efficacy and safety

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate of insertion (quality of ventilation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of insertion, Complication and Glottic seal pressure

clinical_study.condition: Inadequate or Impaired Breathing Pattern or Ventilation

intervention.description: Use Supreme LMA to compare efficay with Proseal LMA in prone position insertion
Use Proseal LMA to compare efficay with Supreme LMA in prone position insertion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society Anesthesiologists physical status I-III
- Patient undergo elective orthopedics surgery in prone position under general anaesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <15year
- Non-fast
- Morbid obesity (BMI > 35kg/m2)
- Pregnancy
- Known or predicted difficult airway
- GERD
- History of laryngeal problem (injury,subglottic stenosis)
- Local pharyngeal problem (abscess,tumor)
- Poor dentation
- Pulmonary disease

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine, Prince of Songkla University
